final_answer.precision_note: 3 significant figures, as equilibrium moles are given to 3 s.f. (0.180 and 0.220)

method: Calculate equilibrium concentrations by dividing moles by volume (2.00 dm3). [NO2] = 0.180 / 2.00 = 0.0900 mol dm-3. [N2O4] = 0.220 / 2.00 = 0.110 mol dm-3. Apply the equilibrium constant expression Kc = [NO2]² / [N2O4]. Substituting values: Kc = (0.0900)² / 0.110 = 0.00810 / 0.110 = 0.0736. The value is reported as dimensionless (unitless) as specified in the constants section.
checks: Concentration check: moles divided by volume 2.00 dm3 gives correct concentrations - verified
Expression check: product concentration squared (NO2) divided by reactant (N2O4) - verified
Magnitude check: similar moles of each species with squared term gives Kc < 1 - verified (0.0736 indicates reactants favored)
